intro: Restio occultus, commonly known as the hidden restio, is a rare and delicate plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The plant features slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Due to its elusive nature and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species. Its botanical characteristics make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies.
